general_advisory: Harvest the matured crops. After harvesting, land preparation can be done for rabi crop production. Plough the land to make the soil friable for good establishment of the crops. During storage of the produce, make sure to use Celphos tablets (Fumigants) to keep away storage insects. Irrigation to the crops should be on time to avoid drying or wilting of plants.

advisory: Remove the weeds from the field.
Keep a regular watch on the pests and diseases.
Milking stage in paddy is an important phase for irrigation. Keep optimum water level in the field.
False smut disease may be seen in paddy field. To manage the same, spray Propiconazole or Hexaconazole @ 100 ml or Copper oxychloride @ 250 g in 200 lt of water per acre.
Gundhi bug: This pest can be seen during milking stage in paddy. To reduce the damage caused by Gundhi bug, spray Malathion 50% EC @ 1 ml/lt or Cypermethrin 10% EC @ 2 ml/lt.
Pulse crop can be taken into consideration for rabi season.
Remove grasses and other unnecessary plants from the respective crop field.
After land preparation, sowing of greengram can be taken in Keonjhar district.
Before sowing of the seeds, always treat the seeds with fungicides like Thiram, Captan etc.
One good irrigation is compulsory after sowing.
Spraying of insecticides should be done in early morning hours to minimize the pest attacks.
Leaf blights in the crop can be managed by spraying Carbendazim or Mancozeb @ 2 g/lt.
The infestation of Red pumpkin beetle can be seen in the field. To reduce the damage, spray Malathion 50 EC @ 1 ml/lt or Methyl demeton 25 EC @ 1 ml/lt.
To control the Powdery mildew disease in the crop, spray Dinocap @ 1 ml/lt or Carbendazim @ 1 g/lt.
The above disease and pest is more likely to infest the crop.
Irrigate the crop regularly.
Harvest the fruits and store them at safe places.
Sell the fruits in the market at good prices.
Pluck/harvest the fruits and keep them at safe places for further domestic consumption or sell in the market.
Any type of sucking pests can be managed by spraying Malathion 50 EC or Dimethoate 30 EC @ 1 ml/lt.
Bending process in guava can be beneficial for more number of branches. For this, tie the branch with the trunk in a bending position. Do not tie very hard rather keep it loose.
Irrigation to the crop can be given according to the soil moisture.
Powder mildew in Guava is a major disease which can be reduced by spraying Sulphur powder @ 2 -3 g/lt.
Spraying should not be done during bright sunshine hours.
Provide support to the plants and the bunch.
Make sure to trim or cut the excess suckers from the mother plant.
Keep only one to two suckers for further growth.
